executive_summary: Sanket Gaikwad is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus diagnosed in 2022. His current HbA1c is 7.5%, which is above the target, indicating a need for improved glycemic control and lifestyle modifications.

clinical_context.recent_events: No recent episodes of hypoglycemia or DKA.

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c is 7.5%, indicating suboptimal glycemic control.
interpretation.plan: Implement lifestyle changes and consider medication to improve glycemic control.

interpretation.assessment: LDL level is 2.5 mmol/L, above the target for high-risk individuals.
interpretation.plan: Recommend dietary changes and consider statin therapy.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Aim for a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on low glycemic index foods, limit saturated fats and sugars.
sample_meals: Grilled chicken salad with mixed greens and vinaigrette
Baked salmon with quinoa and steamed broccoli
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use portion control, aim for balanced meals with appropriate carbohydrate servings.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels between 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia and monitor HbA1c every 3 months.

patient_goals: Engage in physical activity at least 3 times a week.
Reduce LDL cholesterol to < 2.0 mmol/L within 12 months.

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy to improve glycemic control.
Consider statin therapy for elevated LDL cholesterol.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c, lipid profile, and review lifestyle changes.

emr_note: Patient is a 43-year-old male with T1DM, currently with HbA1c of 7.5%. Recommendations include lifestyle modifications and consideration of medication for glycemic and lipid control.
